jurisdiction.title: Roman Catholic Diocese of Joliet Illinois

FABCC2D7F1B249A1AE015CD7866A3A2D.description:
Relate the Apostles’ Creed to
our beliefs.

18DEAF3E34EB4D10A09F736D54B768FB.description:
Explain the purpose of the
Pledge of Allegiance.

4CA43A31B5C845E1935802180649556D.description:
Recognize the state flag and
motto of Illinois.

A528B846A4004006AFF48FA7C797E9F7.description:
Identify an artistic expression
(e.g., song, parenting, film)
that illustrates the traditions
important to our political
system and concept of
freedom.

009A2D08F44C4D82A4990C69D64178D0.description:
Identify reasons why people
have chosen a democracy for
their plan of government.

810B522A476A4E739269E1F1875D8435.description:
Identify saints who have
dedicated their lives to
helping others.

6243294EBA334F88A8337A9535260FEA.description:
Identify examples of people
who are famous for being
honest and truthful (e.g.,
Abraham Lincoln returning
change).

BC01F9150F15427F91FE036864FAFAFA.description: Understand the development of the United States political ideas and traditions. Understand the development of religious/spiritual aspects of the United States political ideas and traditions. Explain the history of the Catholic Church and its impact in human events. CSIS4         Explain how one’s beliefs about God, about humanity, and about material things, affect one’s actions. CSIS7           Value the significance and impact to the Catholic Church throughout history. CSDS5

DF2061B72F0C42DD910EF1984CB73829.description:
Understand that the Church
is one and therefore it is our
responsibility to welcome all
people.

097C74D33DC14E4381D0114FD16FD72A.description:
Tell about people who have
come from other countries to
live in the United States.

3CF220DCA7144EABADD8711FECB1DB95.description:
Describe an example where
the people of the United
States and people from other
countries might need to
cooperate to solve a common
problem.

F0876BA47BAF4204B358E40AE76B763F.description: Understand United States foreign policy as it relates to other nations and international issues. Understand United States foreign policy as it relates to other nations and Catholic Church issues. Identify the motivating values that have informed particular societies and how they correlate with Catholic teaching. CSIS7     Explain what is positive in the world, what needs to be changed, and what injustices must be overcome. CSDS4

29BE72D844D54FC796B389F1B6C7EB7A.description:
Explain why Jesus calls us to
a life of service and to use our
talents to serve others.

3D89527AE4F44C239EE8EACF5740FEB6.description:
Identify some non-profit
agencies, civic groups and/or
Catholic agencies that serve
the common good (e.g., Red
Cross, Salvation Army,
Catholic Charities, Catholic
Relief Services).

E63650F4F9E443D6A2EC101BA0EB6470.description:
Explain why people join
public interest groups (e.g.,
PTA, historical societies, nongovernmental
organizations).

2A357AFF2A4D47B0976C20E712B6F959.description:
Describe a situation wherein
the common good supersedes
the interests of individuals.

D7775B24A44A4F4687485AE7F3BAF9E0.description:
Explain what is meant by the
idea of "the common good of
the people."

40239F5834514869A9573E94731E3B30.description: Understand the roles and influences of individuals and interest groups in the political systems of Illinois, the United States, and other nations. Understand the roles and influences of individual Catholics and Catholic interest groups. Identify the differences among the values of various political systems and how they correlate with Catholic teaching. CSIS7          Recognize how the central themes within the stories of important Catholic figures and saints repeat over time. CSIS6

B9F084F4CF5542CEA4DFB735B87E5077.description:
Explain how to incorporate
Catholic values when voting
for a person running for
public office.

4451080964B34DE888B5F83BE3DD5CE5.description:
Explain why in a democracy
people choose to vote on
important issues or for
offices.

5DA5B3D730B848BFB21D7D0CB796E349.description:
Determine rules for choosing
classroom leaders.

A907F837439244BE8EADE1B4131B4AEB.description:
Describe ways in which more
than one classroom can work
together to help their school.

271A117D226944139A59533E52504EDE.description:
Predict the benefits of acting
responsibly in their classroom.

F4E0DD3E673A41BB9111F1002CDAF725.description:
Identify examples of rights
and responsibilities students
share within a school.

B99427D075DF469D85846FDACAC345B9.description:
List examples of various ways
responsible students work
together (following the
example of Jesus and his
disciples) to help classmates.

CB727014246A4F139B0283457D66C76F.description:
Understand election processes and responsibilities of citizens. Understand the election process and special responsibilities of Catholic citizens. Describe how we can learn about what God does for humanity. CSIS3   Value and develop a love for the common good and our shared humanity, not just with those around us, but for those who have gone before
and those that will come after us. CSDS2           Identify the motivating values that have informed particular societies and how they correlate with Catholic teaching. CSIS7

667C9C409B9240AE98E12B43CC81D4BB.description:
Plan and/or participate in service
projects that help the community.

C0FA8139D2554A45A9F449A2663844E9.description:
List some examples of government
services in their communities that
serve to help people and improve
their lives (e.g., libraries, park
programs, employment offices).

F833C4D0FC8C44EC843A03E0FDB15C21.description:
Explain how local government has
an influence over the lives of
people in their community (e.g.,
they create speed limits, rules
about allowing pets to run free).

8870540237B34268A069045AAF0DD483.description:
Explain the role that state
governments play in the lives of
people.

3B12B1C83C4048B4BB635862659E2734.description:
State the names of the two houses
of the U.S. Congress..

F973B19C62F440B1B3916633F6709759.description:
List the three branches of
government found within the state
and federal government.

3AF320584B7C4EAD863230DE62C3F829.description:
List the names for the levels of
government found throughout the
United States (city, county, state,
federal, or national).

8D53E9387FE7442C986C32FF50767BB4.description:
Identify the current Governor of
the State of Illinois.

63E5AC7BDFA9426995FE7E1D2551AF00.description:
Name the current President and
Vice President of the United
States; name the current Church
leaders (pope, bishop, pastor).

EA57DBC1186E49EB8C7F743016B22941.description: Understand the structures and functions of the political systems of Illinois, the United States, and other nations. Understand the relationship of Church structure and functions to the structures and functions of the political systems of the United States and other nations. Understand what God does for humanity. CSIS3    Understand and explain the human condition and the role and dignity of man in God’s plan. CSIS8        Discuss how Church structure and function can assist man in the acquisition of values and virtues. CSIS12          Identify what is positive in the world, what needs to be transformed, and what injustices must be overcome. CSDS4

6D68BDA14E0C4137B92833DD736CFD2D.description:
Name historical figures from
diverse backgrounds who
advanced rights of
individuals and groups to
promote the common good.

A3D8C0B0FFF34BD8AD13F70FD6EE9B44.description:
Explain why people vote and
run for political offices in a
democracy.

593EFA3D4A6844FC971D9BA695954FA6.description:
Identify the names of people
who occupy government
offices in their community,
state, and federal
government.

C0F9412D6A1A461D971A6CA502888E33.description:
Compare the relationship of
rules and responsibilities to
Church rules and
responsibilities.

CA9B69A38E3548BCA4F931EACBC97BC0.description:
Explain some reasons for
having rules and laws
governing the lives of
people; talk about The Ten
Commandments and how
they can relate to our daily
life.

40546D66279749568971897B3363A1B1.description:
Identify some class or school
rules that were determined
through democratic decisionmaking.

66706CE54DD3476CB559688160F09E39.description:
Distinguish between different
kinds of rules and
responsibilities as applied in
the home, school, community
and Church.

EA1FFA781E5F451BB694AE2ED4B083B4.description: Understand and explain basic principles of the United States government. Understand the relationship of basic principles for the U.S. Government and the Catholic Church Government. Understand what God does for humanity. CSIS3   Understand and explain the human condition and the role and dignity of man in God’s plan. CSIS8

8440F1F31162425EAD1E698C7AAB41C9.description: Understand political systems, with an emphasis on the United States. Understand the relationship of the Church and its systems to political systems of the United States.
